<topcClas>Family life and marriage - Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>         <topcClas>Youth - Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The LSYPE Wave 1 teaching data file contains information obtained from individual interviews and self-completion questionnaires from all 15,770 LSYPE participants. <br> <br> The file contains a selection of 269 of the most commonly-used variables available in the main LSYPE Wave 1 data and is designed for use as a teaching aid and also as a sampler for new and potential users of the main data.<br> <br> Variable names are the same as those on the original LSYPE dataset, held under SN 5545.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Variables for the teaching dataset have been selected from all sections of the questionnaire for the main Wave 1 study. The questionnaire covers:<br> <br> <li>household and demographic information</li><br> <li>languages spoken in the home</li><br> <li>attitudes to the young person's school and involvement in education</li><br> <li>extra-curricular classes</li><br> <li>year 10 subject choices</li><br> <li>special educational needs</li><br> <li>parental expectations and aspirations</li><br> <li>family activities</li><br> <li>parental relationship with young person and contact with services (self-completion)</li><br> <li>reasons young person does not live with natural parents</li><br> <li>household responsibilities and resources (self-completion)</li><br> <li>risk factors (absences, truancy, police contact, bullying) (self-completion)</li><br> <li>individual parent questions</li><br> <br> <br> <br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="single" date="2004-01-01T00:00:00Z">2004</timePrd>         <collDate event="start" date="2004-03-30T00:00:00Z">30 March 2004</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2004-10-19T00:00:00Z">19 October 2004</collDate>         <nation>England</nation>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <anlyUnit> Families/households</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Young people in Year 9 (or equivalent) in schools in England in February 2004 (born between 1 September 1989 and 31 August 1990) and their parents or carers. See documentation for further details.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Longitudinal/panel/cohort</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>Only data from Wave 1 are included at present.</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>BMRB. Social Research</dataCollector>         <dataCollector>NOP World</dataCollector>         <dataCollector>MORI</dataCollector>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <sampProc>See documentation for further details.</sampProc>         <deviat>15,770 households</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview; Self-completion</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details.</weight>         <cleanOps>A*</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage.
